net.sf.jguiraffe.examples.tutorial.bgtask

Class BgTaskCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jguiraffe.gui.cmd.CommandBase
      • net.sf.jguiraffe.examples.tutorial.bgtask.BgTaskCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, FormActionListener, FormEventListener, Command

    public class BgTaskCommand
extends CommandBase
implements FormActionListener

    A command class for executing the background task.

    This command class simulates the execution of a long-running background task. The execute() only sleeps a configurable number of seconds, but it demonstrates how an information dialog with a progress bar can be used to give the user feedback about the progress of the background task. This visual feedback is optional; it can be disabled, then the command only sleeps.

    Version:
    $Id: BgTaskCommand.java 205 2012-01-29 18:29:57Z oheger $
    Author:
    Oliver Heger

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(FormActionEvent e)
        Notifies this object that the cancel button was pressed. This method sets the cancel flag, so that the execution of the command is canceled.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface FormActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - the action event

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws Exception
        Executes this command. Sleeps the specified number of seconds. If visual feedback is enabled, the progress bar is updated.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • performGUIUpdate

        protected void performGUIUpdate()
        Performs UI-related updates after the execution of the command. This implementation closes the information window. Note that this method is only called if visual feedback is enabled.
        Overrides:
        performGUIUpdate in class CommandBase
